summary: The Business Owners Protection Act of 2025 aims to terminate unused authorities of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that were established by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act. Specifically, it targets SEC authorities that provide discretion on establishing requirements for private entities and for which no proposed rulemaking or guidance was issued before January 1, 2025. The bill mandates the SEC to publish a list of terminated authorities within 180 days of the bill's enactment.
